genSynthFlow

Class AreaWorkingCounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • genSynthFlow.AreaWorkingCounts

  • public class AreaWorkingCounts
extends java.lang.Object
    Working counts of flows from each area (OA). These counts are initially built up worker-by-worker when the synthetic population is created, then updated as the population flows are iterated.
    Version:
    1.1, August 2014
    Author:
    Richard Thomas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] areaCount
      Current number of journeys originating in each area
      private ZoneFlowList areaFlowList
      Census-derived flow list associated with this area type
      private double maxMismatch
      largest (typically most positive) proportional mismatch
      private double meanDifference
      arithmetic mean of absolute differences from target counts
      private double minMismatch
      smallest (typically most negative) proportional mismatch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AreaWorkingCounts(ZoneFlowList flowList)
      Create array of current counts of workers assigned to each area (initialised to all zeroes)

      • getMismatch

        public double getMismatch(int indexArea,
                 int tweak)
        Get a measure of the difference between an area's current flow count and the census-derived target flow count. This is scaled to the size of the target count.
        Parameters:
        indexArea - Area Index (to associated FlowList)
        tweak - Adjustment to current OA count
        Returns:
        Difference scaled by target size

      • checkCounts

        public double checkCounts()
        Recalculate differences and proportional mismatches of all area counts against target area counts. Calculate various statistics on these.
        Returns:
        magnitude of worst proportional mismatch
